guide.introduction_rendered:
Sketchup Model

Relevant parts
  • 4"x4"x1/2" Angle Steel
  • 4"x4"x1/2" Angle Steel
  • 2"x2"x1/4" Angle Steel
  • 2"x2"x1/4" Angle Steel
  • 1" rebar
  • 1/8" Sheet Steel
Tools
  • Angle grinder
  • Welder
  • hole puncher
  • torch

lines.text: Torch the guard sheet metal as in the image. It doesn't need to be exact.
lines.text_raw: Torch the guard sheet metal as in the image. It doesn't need to be exact.

lines.text: Note: the shape shown is centered.
lines.text_raw: Note: the shape shown is centered.

lines.text: Weld the top and side 2x2 angle pieces to it as shown.
lines.text_raw: Weld the top and side 2x2 angle pieces to it as shown.

steps.title: Punch the holes in the 4x4 angle

lines.text: Not all holes will be accessible with a punch. Torch the rest.
lines.text_raw: Not all holes will be accessible with a punch. Torch the rest.

lines.text: Torch the hole for mounting the motor in the 8" piece of 4x4 angle. Grind off the slag.
lines.text_raw: Torch the hole for mounting the motor in the 8" piece of 4x4 angle. Grind off the slag.

lines.text: Double check that the hole is large enough by putting on the motor and making sure the raised portion in the center goes all the way thru.
lines.text_raw: Double check that the hole is large enough by putting on the motor and making sure the raised portion in the center goes all the way thru.

lines.text: You can torch separate holes for the bolts, or do one large, odd shaped one like is pictured.
lines.text_raw: You can torch separate holes for the bolts, or do one large, odd shaped one like is pictured.

lines.text: Torch whichever holes you couldn't access with the punch
lines.text_raw: Torch whichever holes you couldn't access with the punch

lines.text: Weld the two 4x4 angle pieces together as pictured, ensuring they are perfectly flush and square.
lines.text_raw: Weld the two 4x4 angle pieces together as pictured, ensuring they are perfectly flush and square.

lines.text: Skip around while welding so it doesn't warp one way or another.
lines.text_raw: Skip around while welding so it doesn't warp one way or another.

lines.text: Grind off the top weld linking the 4x4's so the bearing will be able to sit flush on  it
lines.text_raw: Grind off the top weld linking the 4x4's so the bearing will be able to sit flush on  it

lines.text: Also grind off near the bolt holes on the bottom.
lines.text_raw: Also grind off near the bolt holes on the bottom.

lines.text: Weld the rebars onto the underside of the mount.
lines.text_raw: Weld the rebars onto the underside of the mount.

lines.text: Weld the guard to the top side of the mount.
lines.text_raw: Weld the guard to the top side of the mount.
